{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3557317,"name":"Eric1","username":"Eric1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eric1/{size}/192260_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-14T22:44:07.102Z","cooked":"

Hey, our team is using a limelight 3 with mega tag1 and this is what it looks like.

The issue is that it is incredibly ambigious when we get far away from the apriltag, I think the solution is megatag 2, however in advantage scope it displays the robot spinning in circle around the reef

We are using the CTRE swerve example with pathplanner and the simple integration of megatag, except megatag1, not two

https://imgur.com/a/WBN17cn
(Video of robot struggling with megatag1)

Eric1:

megatag 2, however in advantage scope it displays the robot spinning in circle around the reef

Are you sending the gyro orientation to the limelight every cycle?

It’s in robotPeriodic, so I believe so.

We are using if (Math.random() > .95) {
System.out.println("headingDeg: " + headingDeg);
}

and it is constantly pumping out our heading

kreeve:

Look at the link I sent. You need something like this

we do, I was just using that println statement to understand my robot’s heading which we are feeding it.

Here’s our localization code

*f (kUseLimelight) {
var driveState = m_robotContainer.drivetrain.getState();
double headingDeg = driveState.Pose.getRotation().getDegrees();
double omegaRps = Units.radiansToRotations(driveState.Speeds.omegaRadiansPerSecond);

  LimelightHelpers.SetRobotOrientation("limelight", headingDeg, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
  var llMeasurement = LimelightHelpers.getBotPoseEstimate_wpiRed_MegaTag2("limelight");
  if (llMeasurement != null && llMeasurement.tagCount > 0 && Math.abs(omegaRps) < 2.0) {
    m_robotContainer.drivetrain.addVisionMeasurement(llMeasurement.pose, llMeasurement.timestampSeconds);
  }

I also ran into a similar issue when I was setting up Limelight and using Advantage Scope. If your robot is spinning really fast, the first thing I would check is that Advantage Scope is in Degrees instead of Radians. You should be able to right click the robot’s pose, then go to units and click on Degrees in Advantage Scope. The default is Radians

On this topic, I would also add that you need to turn your robot on when it’s facing the alliance wall like you would before auto. When you turn the robot on, the Pigeon resets itself to zero degrees, so if you turn it on or deploy code when the robot isn’t oriented correctly, the limelight yaw will be off
